title: On the Complexity of Finite-Sum Smooth Optimization under the Polyak-{\L}ojasiewicz Condition
abstract: This paper considers the optimization problem of the form $\min_{{\bf x}\in{\mathbb R}^d} f({\bf x})\triangleq \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n f_i({\bf x})$, where $f(\cdot)$ satisfies the Polyak--{\L}ojasiewicz (PL) condition with parameter $\mu$ and $\{f_i(\cdot)\}_{i=1}^n$ is $L$-mean-squared smooth. We show that any gradient method requires at least $\Omega(n+\kappa\sqrt{n}\log(1/\epsilon))$ incremental first-order oracle (IFO) calls to find an $\epsilon$-suboptimal solution, where $\kappa\triangleq L/\mu$ is the condition number of the problem.
